newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil shares end off slightly on short-covering.
newsitem.headline: Brazil shares end off slightly on short-covering.

text.p: Brazilian stocks closed slightly lower in moderate trade as key players drove down the market to cover short positions, traders said.
"There are some large players who were short and they had to drive the market down to cover their positions. Other than that, there was no reason for us to fall," said one trader.
The Bovespa index of the 55 most-active stocks ended down 0.76 percent to close at 65,139. Volume stood at 394.5 million reais ($387.6 million).
81.60, down 0.61 percent, while its voting common stock closed down 1.04 percent at 66.80.
State oil firm Petrobras preferred shares fell 1.24 percent to close at 119.
Traders said the market would remain tepid due to a lack of local news until after next month's municipal elections.
